resource.description: The namespace and ID of a power that will be evaluated.
resource.markdownDescription: The namespace and ID of a power that will be evaluated.

comparison.description: Determines how the value of the specified power should be compared to the specified value.
comparison.markdownDescription: Determines how the value of the specified power should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value at which the value of the specified power will be compared to.
compare_to.markdownDescription: The value at which the value of the specified power will be compared to.

type.description:
## Resource --- [Entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/resource) Checks the value of a power that uses the [Resource (Power Type)](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/resource) or a power type that has a built-in cooldown (using remaining ticks as the value). Type ID: `origins:resource` --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:resource", "resource": "example:a_simple_resource", "comparison": "==", "compare_to": 1 } ``` This example will check if the player has a value of 1 in the `example:a_simple_resource` resource power. (`data\example\powers\a_simple_resource.json`)
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:resource", "resource": "example:a_multiple_power_with_resource_subpower", "comparison": ">", "compare_to": 50 } ``` This example will check if the player has a value of more than 50 in the `with_resource_subpower` sub-power of `example:a_multiple_power` power. (`data\example\powers\a_multiple_power.json`)

## Resource --- [Entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/resource) Checks the value of a power that uses the [Resource (Power Type)](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/resource) or a power type that has a built-in cooldown (using remaining ticks as the value). Type ID: `origins:resource` --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:resource", "resource": "example:a_simple_resource", "comparison": "==", "compare_to": 1 } ``` This example will check if the player has a value of 1 in the `example:a_simple_resource` resource power. (`data\example\powers\a_simple_resource.json`)
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:resource", "resource": "example:a_multiple_power_with_resource_subpower", "comparison": ">", "compare_to": 50 } ``` This example will check if the player has a value of more than 50 in the `with_resource_subpower` sub-power of `example:a_multiple_power` power. (`data\example\powers\a_multiple_power.json`)

x-intellij-html-description:
title: Resource (Entity Condition Type) date: 2021-04-04

Resource

Entity Condition Type

Checks the value of a power that uses the Resource (Power Type) or a power type that has a built-in cooldown (using remaining ticks as the value).

Type ID: origins:resource

Fields

Field Type Default Description
resource Identifier The namespace and ID of a power that will be evaluated.
comparison Comparison Determines how the value of the specified power should be compared to the specified value.
compare_to Integer The value at which the value of the specified power will be compared to.

Examples

"condition": {
    "type": "origins:resource",
    "resource": "example:a_simple_resource",
    "comparison": "==",
    "compare_to": 1
}

This example will check if the player has a value of 1 in the example:a_simple_resource resource power. (data\example\powers\a_simple_resource.json) 

"condition": {
    "type": "origins:resource",
    "resource": "example:a_multiple_power_with_resource_subpower",
    "comparison": ">",
    "compare_to": 50
}

This example will check if the player has a value of more than 50 in the with_resource_subpower sub-power of example:a_multiple_power power. (data\example\powers\a_multiple_power.json)
